level.narration: Julie: OMG Damien are you slacking off again???
Julie: You know graph paper is for graphing things, right? This is algebra class?
Julie: Ooh you have pink crayons?! I love pink :3 Damien: What? No it's totally red. Julie: Colorblind much?
Julie: Awww the blocks get to be friends! This is so cute! Damien: â€¦"cute" isn't really the adjective I would use. Julie: Oh hush, you're the one who made them pink.
Damien: Noooooo don't touch that Julie: But it's pretty Damien: But you'll be trapped here foreveeeeer Julie: Okay jeez I hear you.

Julie: So what if I have too many blocks? Damien: Well, so long as some of them cover the goal, you're fine. Julie: So they can all be friends! Cute! Damien: Can we at least call them "fierce allies" instead of "friends."
Damien: OMG are you slacking off again? Shouldn't you be paying attention to class? Julie: Oh hush, this is all your fault anyway.
Julie: Whoa, dissolving acid? Do you think we could pour that junk on Ms. Hall's hair? You know it's hideous.

Julie: Wait, so you said the way this acid works, I pour it on my arm and then I'd have my hand just floating beside me? Damien: Yeah, I saw it in a comic book. Julie: I can't decide if that's gross or cool. Damien: Definitely cool.
Julie: DAMIEN. Now you're just being mean!
Damien: Haha are you ready to give up yet? Julie: Oh shush

Julie: Wait, first acid, now teleportation? What's the next superpower gonna be, dragons??? Damien: What. "Dragons" is not a superpower. Damien: Also I would need to upgrade from graph paper for that...
